```{r}
library(readr)
tyre <- read_csv("tyre.csv")
head(tyre)
```


```{r}
p <- ggplot(tyre, aes(x = Brands, y = Mileage)) + 
  geom_boxplot(aes(fill=Brands)) +
  geom_jitter() +
  #Labels
  labs(title= "Rendimiento de Gomas en PuertoRico", x="Gomas", y="Kilometers") +
#Themes
  theme_linedraw() +
  theme(plot.title = element_text(size = 18,
                                  face = "bold",
                                  hjust = 0.5,
                                  color = "cornflowerblue")) + 
  theme(axis.title.y = element_text(size =18,
                                    face ="bold",
                                    color="lightblue"),
        axis.text.y = element_text(size = 16,
                                   face = "plain",
                                   color = "black")) +
  theme(axis.title.x = element_text(size = 18,
                                    face = "bold",
                                    color = "blue"),
        axis.text.x = element_text(size = 16,
                                   face = "plain",
                                   color = "black")) +
  theme(legend.title = element_text(size = 18,
                                    face = "italic",
                                    color = "black")) 
        
  
  

p

```

#Assumption checks
```{r}
mod <- aov(Mileage ~ Brands, data = tyre)
summary(mod)

residuals_mod <- residuals(mod)

shapiro.test(residuals_mod)

leveneTest(Mileage ~ Brands, data = tyre)
#high p value = equal variance


```

```{r}
post_test <- TukeyHSD(mod)
post_test
```
